thread.title: Texas & Neighbors: Austin Celtic Festival honors heritage
thread.title_full: Texas & Neighbors: Austin Celtic Festival honors heritage | Dallas Morning News

author: MARY DUNKLIN
title: Texas & Neighbors: Austin Celtic Festival honors heritage
text:
COLEMAN Prickly Pear event features food, wines from across state Make plans to visit Coleman from noon to 10:30 p.m. Oct. 24 for the Prickly Pear Food and Wine Fest.
The day includes wine tastings and samples from Texas chefs and wineries. Featured chefs include “Pastry Queen” Rebecca Rather and Barry Cooper of Cooper’s BBQ. Wineries include Llano Estacado, Messina Hof and more.
Also included are craft vendors, food trucks and open-mike performances.
Admission is $10. An all-access pass (which includes food and wine pairings and a souvenir goblet) is $40. Children younger than 12 are $5.
Contact: secure.lenos.com/lenos/signal/pricklypear2015/home.htm
NATCHITOCHES, LA. Light up the holidays with fireworks, parade It’s not too early to start planning for Christmas. Add a visit to Natchitoches, La., to your holiday to-do list.
The city’s Turn on the Holidays celebration is from Nov. 21 to Jan. 6 and includes performances, home tours and 300,000 Christmas lights.
A highlight of the event is the 89th annual Christmas Festival on Dec. 5. The daylong festival was ranked third “best holiday light show” in the nation by Yahoo.com. It includes a parade, musical entertainment, vendors and a fireworks show choreographed to holiday music over the Cane River Lake.
Admission armbands are required and can be purchased online starting Nov. 1.
Contact: natchitocheschristmas.com
LITTLE ROCK Cornbread lovers can get their fill at Arkansas fest Amateurs and professionals will cook their best Southern dishes during the fifth Arkansas Cornbread Festival on Nov. 7. The event, which will be from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m., is on South Main Street in Little Rock.
There will be several varieties of cornbread to sample and purchase. Stay for the music, vendors and shopping. Keep an eye out for festival mascot Cosmo, who loves greeting and taking photos with attendees.
Discounted tickets are available online for $7, children 6-12 are $3. Children 5 and younger are free.
Contact: arkansascornbreadfestival.com
AUSTIN Festival honors Celtic heritage with song, dance and sports The Austin Celtic Festival, which will be Nov. 7-8, celebrates traditional culture and music.
The event offers workshops throughout the weekend, including Irish storytelling, guitar lessons, dance classes and Celtic sports.
Tickets are $18 and can be bought only online. A weekend pass is $30. Children 12 and younger are free.
Hours are noon to 7:30 p.m. Gates open at 11 a.m.
Traveler’s tip: Holiday Inn Midtown is offering a discounted rate of $109 for festival attendees. The hotel is at 6000 Middle Fiskville Road. Call 512-451-5757 and use the discount code ACE.
Contact: Fiesta Gardens, 2102 Jesse E. Segovia St., Austin. austincelticfestival.com
